medical_history.chief_complaint: Left lower quadrant abdominal pain for 2 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient was in usual state of health until one day prior to presentation when she noted the onset of left lower quadrant abdominal pain. The pain is described as constant with waves of increased intensity, with maximum severity reported. There are no radiation or alleviating/aggravating factors. The patient also experiences intermittent chills.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Ulcerative colitis, lung nodules, partial thyroidectomy, tubal ligation, benign ovarian mass, total abdominal hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy, melanoma of the left foot (treated with wide excision followed by immunotherapy).
medical_history.family_history: Mother has a history of stroke and lung cancer.
